intro: Corydalis solida var. pauciflora, commonly known as the slender corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or woodland habitats and is known for its low-growing, mat-forming habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a soft, hairy texture, while its stems are slender and somewhat succulent. This variant is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
